newsitem.title: UK: Rackwood makes cashcall to fund acquisition.
newsitem.headline: Rackwood makes cashcall to fund acquisition.

text.p: British coal firm Rackwood Minerals Holdings Plc said on Thursday it was making a five for eight rights issue at 50p per share to raise 7.43 million stg.
It said in a statement that the proceeds from the cash call will be used to pay the outstanding 1.86 million stg for the remaining land at a site in Ayrshire, Scotland.
The rights issue cash will also be used to repay debt of 2.3 million stg.
"We expect the Skares Road (Ayrshire) site to produce some 360,000 tonnes of coal in 1998 building up to approximately 500,000 tonnes in 1999," said chairman Dennis Bell.
The company produced 382,000 tonnes of coal from its own sites in 1996.
